intro: Matthiola lunata var. phlox, commonly known as sweet rocket, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is characterized by its fragrant, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces small, heart-shaped leaves. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained soil. This variety is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
